definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Rescuers worked after daybreak to try to reach those trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
sentences.chinese: 救援人员拂晓开始搜寻被埋在倒坍建筑物瓦砾中的人。

sentences.english: Temples and statues decay, but books survieve.
sentences.chinese: 寺庙会倒坍，神像会朽烂，而书却经久长存。

sentences.english: The wall went down with a crash.
The child tried to build a house of cards but it soon fell over.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子试着用牌搭一所房子，可是它一会儿就倒坍了。

sentences.english: You remove one of those cards and the whole thing comes tumbling down.
sentences.chinese: 如果你拿掉了其中的一些牌，所有的一切就是倒坍。

sentences.english: The building collapsed after the fire.
When the football fans got into a frenzied fight, the spectators' stand collapsed and a horrible disaster occurred.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们疯狂地争斗起来，看台倒坍，酿成惨祸。

sentences.english: Then tons of rock come crashing down, smashing it into junk.
sentences.chinese: 数吨重的岩石轰然倒坍，被机甲碎成垃圾。

definition: to collapse (of building, dam or bridge)
to collapse/to crash down/to fall down in a heap
the tiles are broken, the walls dilapidated
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to level/to raze to the ground
